snippet: As Europe observes the Waterloo bicentennial, the legend of the defeated emperor continues to draw crowds while Wellington, the victor, is often forgotten.
abstract: Ligny Journal; re-enactment of Battle of Ligny opens with weeklong series of events to commemorate Napoleon’s ultimate defeat at Waterloo on June 18, 1815; British public remembers Waterloo as decisive victory that reshaped Europe in their favor, while French paint Napoleon as hero.
lead_paragraph: As Europe observes the Waterloo bicentennial, the legend of the defeated emperor continues to draw crowds while Wellington, the victor, is often forgotten.

headline.print_headline: 200 Years After Waterloo, Napoleon Wins by Losing
headline.main: 200 Years After Waterloo, Napoleon Still Wins by Losing
